checking.compile

Class JavaCompileChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • checking.compile.JavaCompileChecker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CompileChecker

    public class JavaCompileChecker
extends java.lang.Object
implements CompileChecker
    This class provides the means to check submissions in java for correct compilation.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JavaCompileChecker(java.nio.file.Path pathToJunitTests)
      The constructor for the compileChecker only checks if javac can be found in PATH on windows systems.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CompilerOutput checkProgram(java.nio.file.Path pathToSourceFolder, java.nio.file.Path outputFolder, java.lang.String compilerName, java.util.List<java.lang.String> compilerFlags)
      Invokes the compiler on a given file and reports the output.
      CompilerOutput checkProgram(java.nio.file.Path pathToProgramFile, java.lang.String compilerName, java.util.List<java.lang.String> compilerFlags)
      Convenience Method to call without specifying an output folder.

    • Constructor Detail

      • JavaCompileChecker

        public JavaCompileChecker(java.nio.file.Path pathToJunitTests)
        The constructor for the compileChecker only checks if javac can be found in PATH on windows systems.
        Parameters:
        pathToJunitTests - points to the location of the provided JUnit test files. If none are given this parameter must be null.

    • Method Detail

      • checkProgram

        public CompilerOutput checkProgram(java.nio.file.Path pathToSourceFolder,
                          java.nio.file.Path outputFolder,
                          java.lang.String compilerName,
                          java.util.List<java.lang.String> compilerFlags)
                            throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                   BadCompilerSpecifiedException,
                                   BadFlagException,
                                   CompilerOutputFolderExistsException
        Invokes the compiler on a given file and reports the output.
        Specified by:
        checkProgram in interface CompileChecker
        Parameters:
        pathToSourceFolder - Specifies the folder where source files are located.
        outputFolder - Directory where the resulting binaries are placed
        compilerName - The compiler to be used (usually javac).
        compilerFlags - Additional flags to be passed to the compiler.
        Returns:
        A CompilerOutput that contains all compiler messages and flags on how the compile run went.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - Is thrown when the file in pathToProgramFile cannot be opened
        BadCompilerSpecifiedException - Is thrown when the given compiler cannot be called
        BadFlagException - When javac doesn't recognize a flag, this exception is thrown.
        CompilerOutputFolderExistsException - The output folder may not exist. This is thrown when it does exist.
